questions.text: Kara started her new job at CatCo during this episode. What was it?
questions.explanation:
Reporter.

	Kara had wavered during the previous episode about what she wanted to do. She finally decided at the end of the episode, and opened this episode with the prospects of starting her new position within the company.

questions.text: What were Superman and Supergirl doing the first time they were on screen together?
questions.explanation:
Stopping several small crimes.

	First they put out a fire, then they stopped a robbery, before going off to fight an alien at the request of Hank Henshaw (the alien fight wasn't shown on screen). They were still getting used to fighting side by side and getting to know each other better.

questions.text: What element helped to power up Metallo?
questions.explanation:
Kryptonite.

	John Corben, who was turned into Metallo, worked for an organization called Cadmus. He was enhanced into being an cyborg powered by Kryptonite, the one substance that could harm Superman or Supergirl.

questions.text: What did Supergirl call herself and Superman?
questions.explanation:
#TeamKrypton.

	She said that while being yelled at by Hank for not following proper protocols when catching aliens. Hank told her she was simply having #TooMuchFun. Hank and Superman didn't get along.

questions.text: Clark got drunk during a dinner with Kara and Alex.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Alcohol doesn't affect Kryptonians at all. Alex asked if Clark preferred red or white wine. Kara told her that Clark was a supernerd and wouldn't drink despite it not affecting them.

questions.text: Where did Hank and Superman go together?
questions.explanation:
Fortress of Solitude.

	The two didn't get along because the DEO kept stores of Kryptonite.  The DEO, or Department of Extranormal Operations, was run by Hank. They chose to work together to try to find a way to beat Metallo, though they still didn't see eye to eye.

questions.text: Who built new suits for Kara and Clark?
questions.explanation:
Wynn.

	Wynn moved from his job at CatCo. At his new job with the DEO, one of his first assignments was to build suits for the two Kryptonians to wear. The suits were to be based on technology left by Non. He was the season one major villain.

questions.text: What did Alex and Kara fight over?
questions.correct: Kara was thinking about moving to Metropolis.
options: Kara wanted to quit working with the DEO.
The reason wasn't stated during this episode.
Kara ate the last slice of pizza at dinner.
questions.explanation:
Kara was thinking about moving to Metropolis.

	Kara was considering moving to Metropolis to be near Superman. She said he made her feel whole, and that he was the only one that could truly understand her. Alex was upset that Kara wanted to leave after she had spent her life protecting Kara's secret.

questions.correct: Head of investigative reporting for CatCo
options: A person Kara met while saving his life
questions.explanation:
Head of investigative reporting for CatCo.

	He was played by Ian Gomez. In the comics, he is a superhero in his own right, however in the this episode he appears to be just a mortal man. He was rude to Kara and at first refused to acknowledge that she worked for him since he didn't hire her.

questions.text: Cat Grant left her company near the end of the episode.
questions.explanation:
True.

	She left on a leave of absence with nothing left to prove. She told Kara she was going to do it midway through the episode, and Supergirl and she talked about it as the episode concluded. James was appointed to take over as the CEO of the company while Cat was gone.
